title: White Screen After Champ Select (Mac)
body:
Solution: Apparently spamming space bar and return while on the white/black screen solves the issue.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
After champ select instead of going to the loading screen the client starts up but I just get a white screen. I can't tab out of it and if I command - alt - escape it closes but when I click reconnect the same thing happens. I've tried restarting league and my computer. I played multiple games today before this started happening and now this happens whenever I try to play a game.

Update: I used the "initiate full repair" button in the client settings under general and stopped having
 the issue.

replies.body:
Yeah! I tried the _spamming spacebar_ on the "white screen of death" solution and it worked! 

From my understanding, I started getting this error problem with the white screen on normal client and the "unknown directx error" on my beta account recently after I downloaded the beta client. I also have a macbook pro and from my understanding people who have this similar situation also seem to have recently downloaded the pbe client. 

Perhaps there is an issue for mac users in which involves the downloading of the pbe. I wish I found this forum earlier because I tried repairing the clients, deleting and reinstalling, updating everything again, reinstalling my mac's system update, doing another full and complete update on my macbook again, and pretty much EVERYTHING you can think of. But right now, as a temporary fix, it seems spamming spacebar on the white screen for the normal server works. I hope Riot can fix this soon! 

P.S. Again, I feel this problem mostly involves players that use mac and also recently installed the pbe, I may be wrong though but that's for me at least.

Ahhhhh that white screen for Windows programs typically means the program is "not responding", a sort of crash. If you force closed it at that point, some of the background processes were still running probably which interfered with you trying to reconnect. 

Essentially everything went really wrong in this case, unfortunately. Open your task manager and make sure you close out all instances/processes of League, and then run a quick repair to check for possibly corrupted game files that caused that initial crash. Let me know if that doesn't help, and we may need to get you over to our techs for deeper troubleshooting.
